bug.short_desc: [kernel] switching to a virtual console freezes graphical login screen and desktop environment
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: For current Fedora 25, attempts to switch to a virtual console freeze the graphical login screen and the GNOME desktop on a Lenovo T400 with an ATI Mobility Radeon HD 3470 (RV620) video device after updating to kernels of the 4.10 series (originally reported for Fedora 26 as bug 1416108). It seems that the switch is actually carried out but the screen is not updated accordingly. It is still possible to switch back to the original (graphical) console or to reboot the system via ctrl-alt-del.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): kernel-4.10.8-200.fc25
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Boot system with current Fedora 25. 2. Try to switch from graphical login screen or from a GNOME session to a virtual console.
Actual results: The switch does not seem to be carried out, and the graphical login screen and GNOME desktop, respectively, appear frozen: the clock does not advance any longer, and no response to keyboard or mouse input is observed (except switching back to the (graphical) virtual console).
Expected results: System switches to the selected virtual console.
Additional info: 1. After switching back to the (graphical) virtual console, the desktop becomes usable again. 2. The issue was absent from Fedora 25 until recently but affected Fedora 26 for which it was reported as bug 1416108. It was resolved for Fedora 26 by kernel-4.11.0-0.rc4.git0.1.fc26. 3. Switching from a GNOME on Wayland to a GNOME on Xorg session does not make a substantial difference.

I have the same problem.
Some additional info: 1. My VGA controller is a "Intel Corporation Xeon E3-1200 v3/4th Gen Core Processor Integrated Graphics Controller (rev 06)" 2. I can confirm that the "agetty" process is created in the expected tty 3. Booting the last 4.9 kernel installed (4.9.14-200) solves the problem
